intro: Lithospermum vesicarium, commonly known as blisterweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and blue to purple flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in prairies and open woodlands. Lithospermum vesicarium is known for its ability to exude a sticky, milky sap when damaged.
